title: Romantic Valentine prompt page with evasive No button and Yes reveal meme

requirements.text: Create a single-page romantic Valentine UI that asks the question “Will you be my Valentine?” and presents exactly two prominent options: “Yes” and “No”, using a pink-and-white romantic theme suitable for iPad Chrome.

quotes:
Create an interactive web page as a surprise for my girlfriend. The page should be simple, romantic-themed, and have only one purpose: to ask her to be my Valentine.
There should be two options: Yes or No.
... The page should be themed
romantically with a pink and white color scheme

acceptanceCriteria: Landing view shows the question “Will you be my Valentine?” with two buttons labeled “Yes” and “No”.
Overall styling is clearly romantic and uses a pink/white palette (background, typography, accents).
Layout is responsive and usable on iPad Chrome in both portrait and landscape.

requirements.text: Implement interactive behavior where the “No” button moves to a different position whenever the user tries to interact with it (e.g., hover/pointer enter), making it effectively unclickable.

quotes: When she hovers her cursor over No, it should move away so she cannot click it, forcing her to click only on Yes.

acceptanceCriteria: On pointer hover/enter over the “No” button, it immediately relocates to a different position within the visible area.
The “No” button remains within the viewport and does not overlap the “Yes” button or the main question text.

requirements.text: Add a touch-friendly fallback so that on touch devices (iPad), attempting to tap the “No” button causes it to move away before a click can be completed.

quotes: ...fully interactive ... so that I can easily run it on my iPad using Chrome.

acceptanceCriteria: On touchstart/tap attempt on “No”, the button relocates before it can be successfully clicked.
The experience remains smooth and does not require a keyboard or mouse to function.

requirements.text: When the user clicks “Yes”, replace the initial prompt with a celebratory view that displays a meme image and the message “Good choice”.

quotes: When she clicks Yes, show her a meme image telling her "Good choice

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “Yes” transitions to a new state that shows the meme image and the exact text “Good choice”.
After “Yes” is clicked, the “Yes/No” buttons are no longer shown or are clearly disabled/irrelevant.

requirements.text: Add the required generated image asset(s) under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them from the frontend (do not fetch images from the backend).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated image file(s) exist in frontend/public/assets/generated with the exact filenames specified in the image requirements.
Frontend displays the image via a static path (e.g., /assets/generated/...).

constraints: Frontend must be built using the existing React + TypeScript + Tailwind stack (no plain standalone HTML file output).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or the immutable hook/main entry paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
No third-party auth or external services; keep the app fully self-contained for running in iPad Chrome.
nonGoals: User accounts, login, or Internet Identity integration.
Multiple pages, navigation, or additional app functionality beyond the Valentine prompt and its interactions.

required: Meme-style romantic image with bold readable text “Good choice”, pink/white palette, heart accents (valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1024x1024.png)
